title: How to spot a misleading graph - Lea Gaslowitz

options.label: B

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: The first graph shows the temperature in Fahrenheit, while the second graph shows the temperature in Celsius.

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: Look at the graph and try to find a flaw in the data.

options.text: Because graphs can be used to make decisions.

options.label: B
options.text: Because it helps to visualize complex data.

options.label: C
options.text: Because it helps to make decisions.

title: What causes kidney stones? - Arash Shadman

multiple-choice.question: What is recommended to prevent kidney stones?

options.label: B
options.text: To generate electricity from mechanical stress

options.label: C
options.text: To convert electrical energy into mechanical energy

options.label: D
options.text: To measure the depth of water

options.label: B
options.text: The absence of a center of symmetry

options.label: C
options.text: The distribution of electric charge within the unit cell

options.label: B

options.label: C

title: How does asthma work? - Christopher E. Gaw

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary effect of chronic inflammation in individuals with asthma?

options.label: A
options.text: It reduces airway sensitivity and inflammation.

options.label: B
options.text: It makes the airways less responsive to triggers.

options.label: C
options.text: It causes the mucosal lining to become more swollen and secrete more mucus.

options.label: D
options.text: It relaxes constricted muscles, allowing the airways to widen.

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of reliever medications in inhalers?

options.label: A
options.text: To reduce airway sensitivity and inflammation.

options.label: B
options.text: To relax constricted muscles, allowing the airways to widen.

options.label: C
options.text: To transport medication along the affected airways to treat the problem at its source.

options.label: D
options.text: To prevent asthma symptoms over the long term.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of hyperinflation in asthma?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased oxygen delivery to the body's organs and tissues.

options.label: B
options.text: Reduced oxygen delivery to the body's organs and tissues.

options.label: C
options.text: No change in oxygen delivery to the body's organs and tissues.

options.label: D
options.text: Increased air pressure in the lungs.

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary cause of asthma attacks?

options.label: A
options.text: Exposure to triggers such as tobacco smoke, pollen, dust, fragrances, exercise, cold weather, stress, and the common cold.

options.label: B
options.text: Chronic inflammation and hyper-responsiveness of the airways.

options.label: C
options.text: Genetic and environmental factors acting during early childhood.

options.label: D
options.text: Poverty and difficulties in obtaining medical care or treatment.

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of preventive medications in inhalers?

options.label: A
options.text: To treat asthma symptoms immediately and contain beta-agonists.

options.label: B
options.text: To reduce airway sensitivity and inflammation.

options.label: C
options.text: To relax constricted muscles, allowing the airways to widen.

options.label: D
options.text: To transport medication along the affected airways to treat the problem at its source.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of untreated severe asthma attacks?

options.label: B
options.text: Reduced oxygen delivery to the body's organs and tissues.

options.label: C
options.text: Increased oxygen delivery to the body's organs and tissues.

options.label: D
options.text: No change in oxygen delivery to the body's organs and tissues.

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary approach to managing asthma?

options.label: A
options.text: Reducing exposure to triggers and using inhalers.

options.label: C
options.text: Relaxing constricted muscles, allowing the airways to widen.

options.label: D
options.text: Transporting medication along the affected airways to treat the problem at its source.

multiple-choice.question: What is the role of poverty in asthma incidents?

options.label: A
options.text: It has no role in asthma incidents.

options.label: B
options.text: It is a contributing factor to asthma incidents.

options.label: C
options.text: It is a protective factor against asthma incidents.

options.label: D
options.text: It has a neutral effect on asthma incidents.

multiple-choice.question: What is the current understanding of the causes of asthma?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a single genetic disorder.

options.label: B
options.text: It is a single environmental factor.

options.label: C
options.text: It is a combination of genetic and environmental factors.

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary benefit of using inhalers in asthma management?

options.label: B
options.text: Relaxing constricted muscles, allowing the airways to widen.

options.label: C
options.text: Transporting medication along the affected airways to treat the problem at its source.

options.label: D
options.text: Preventing asthma symptoms over the long term.

options.text: They eat mainly meat, such as insects and small animals.

multiple-choice.question: Why do sloths have a slow metabolism?

options.text: They don't need to burn a lot of energy to move around.

options.label: C
options.text: They have a small body size.

options.label: D
options.text: They live in a cold climate.

multiple-choice.question: What is the advantage of sloths having a slow metabolism?

options.label: B

options.label: C
